noun.description: A small mark or flaw which spoils the appearance of something.
examples: the merest blemish on a Rolls Royce might render it unsalable

verb.description: Spoil the appearance of (something) that is otherwise aesthetically perfect.
examples: his reign as world champion has been blemished by controversy
thousands of Web pages are blemished with embarrassing typos

origin: Late Middle English (as a verb): from Old French ble(s)miss-, lengthened stem of ble(s)mir make pale, injure; probably of Germanic origin.
